title: Delhi blast suspect circled Connaught Place before proceeding to Red Fort
content: A chilling timeline of the i20 car that exploded near Red Fort reveals its journey from Faridabad, with the driver, Mohammed Umar, strategically waiting in a crowded Delhi area.  CCTV footage tracked the vehicle's movements for hours before the devastating blast, which killed nine and injured thirty. Investigators are scrutinizing over a thousand cameras to determine if Umar acted alone.

title: 'America don't have talented people': Is Trump softening rules on aggressive H-1B visa?
content: President Trump acknowledged the necessity of importing foreign talent to maintain America's industrial and technological edge, even while supporting higher wages for American workers. He argued that the US lacks sufficient skilled individuals for complex manufacturing and defense roles, citing an ICE raid on a Hyundai plant as an example of difficulties caused by removing foreign expertise.

title: Red Fort blast crushes Delhi e-rickshaw driver’s dreams, leaves family devastated
content: An e-rickshaw driver, Mohammad Jumman, was confirmed dead after his family endured agonizing uncertainty following his disappearance. His last known location was amidst heavy traffic near Lal Qila. Jumman was the sole breadwinner for his specially-abled wife and three children, leaving them in a precarious situation.

title: Dharmendra discharged from Breach Candy Hospital
content: Veteran actor Dharmendra, who was admitted to the hospital for breathlessness, has been discharged. Amidst false death rumours, his family, including Esha Deol and Sunny Deol's team, confirmed his stable condition and recovery.  The actor is now home, bringing immense relief to his devoted fans and loved ones.

title: 'Anybody ready to mess with us?': Chahal's video with Sanju Samson goes viral - watch
content: The player auction for the Indian Premier League (IPL) 2026 is likely to take place in Abu Dhabi, with December 16 emerging as the most probable date for the event. If confirmed, this will mark the third consecutive overseas auction after previous editions were hosted in Jeddah, Saudi Arabia, and Dubai, United Arab Emirates.

title: Why Xiaomi CEO bought three Tesla Model Ys and ripped them apart
content: Xiaomi's CEO, Lei Jun, revealed his company's strategy to challenge Tesla by completely disassembling three Model Ys to understand their engineering. This meticulous reverse-engineering approach has paid off, with Xiaomi's new YU7 SUV garnering over 240,000 preorders in just 24 hours.  While praising Tesla's innovation, Lei highlighted the YU7's competitive pricing and superior interior space and battery performance, underscoring the intense battle for dominance in China's booming electric vehicle market.

title: Groww IPO listing: Fintech major lists at 14% premium on BSE, 12% on NSE – check details
content: Groww shares debuted on Dalal Street with a premium, listing at Rs 114 on the BSE and Rs 112 on the NSE, exceeding grey market expectations. Analysts are cautiously optimistic about the fintech platform's long-term prospects, citing strong customer growth and a scalable business model despite regulatory headwinds.

title: Delhi AQI crosses 400: GRAP-3 in force; schools continue hybrid classes
content: Delhi-NCR's air quality plunged into the 'severe' category with an AQI of 413, prompting the Delhi government to activate Stage III of the Graded Response Action Plan. This includes a ban on most construction, industrial operations not using clean fuels, and diesel generators. Schools for younger students are shifting to a hybrid learning model.

title: Price prediction: Will gold continue to rally? Levels investors should watch out for
content: Gold price prediction today: Gold prices are poised for potential gains, with analysts suggesting buying on dips as a smart move.  Factors like a weakening US labor market, increased chances of Federal Reserve rate cuts, and China's continued gold purchases are bolstering the yellow metal. Silver also shows a positive outlook, supported by its critical mineral status.

title: Vibe coding: Meta’s AI chief has advice for teens: Says they should spend time on..
content: Meta's AI chief, Alexandr Wang, urges teenagers to master AI tools, likening the current era to the dawn of personal computing. He advises dedicating thousands of hours to 'vibe-coding' – hands-on experimentation with AI – to gain a significant future economic advantage, much like early programmers. This rapid, iterative approach is key to understanding and maximizing AI's potential.

title: Govinda rushed to hospital after collapse; actor under medical observation
content: Veteran actor Govinda has been hospitalized after reportedly collapsing at his Juhu residence. The 61-year-old star was rushed to CritiCare Hospital in Mumbai and is currently under observation and undergoing tests. Known for his iconic roles, fans are wishing him a speedy recovery.

title: Watch: 'Back home in whites' — Stunning BTS video of Team India’s prep at Eden Gardens
content: Team India is intensely preparing for their upcoming Test series against South Africa at Kolkata's Eden Gardens. A video montage shared by the BCCI showcases players fine-tuning their skills, with skipper Shubman Gill spending over 90 minutes in the nets. The team's return to red-ball cricket is highlighted as they get ready for the opening Test.

title: Chinese Cryptoqueen caught: UK police seize Bitcoin; scam worth billion exposed
content: A Chinese woman has received an 11-year sentence in the UK for laundering millions embezzled from pensioners. Qian Zhimin, who fled China, used a fake passport to enter the UK and lived lavishly. Police seized one of the world's largest crypto hauls, with the Bitcoin's value soaring significantly since its discovery.

title: How never to get cancer - Doctor shares 8 scientifically proven tips
content: Global wellness expert Dr. Eric Berg offers eight practical tips to bolster your body's defenses against cancer.  These include optimizing Vitamin D, embracing intermittent fasting, adopting a low-carb diet, and trying cold water therapy.  Incorporating herbs, an anti-cancer diet, managing iron levels, and daily movement with fresh air are also highlighted for long-term wellness and resilience.

title: UPSC CSE Mains 2025: Result released; direct link to download here
content: The Union Public Service Commission has released the Civil Services Main Examination 2025 results today, November 11, 2025. Over 2,700 candidates have advanced to the Personality Test stage.  A direct link to check the results on upsc.gov.in is available. Shortlisted individuals must present original documents for the interview, with verification of previously submitted details being mandatory for e-summon letters.

title: Earth's reality check: UN Climate Change Conference venue flooded in Brazil
content: COP30 in Brazil commenced amidst heavy rain and flooding that disrupted venues and press conferences, drawing ironic commentary. The opening day also saw activists clash with security, resulting in minor injuries and highlighting concerns over Indigenous participation and resource allocation for the event.

title: Who gets highest bid if Virat, Rohit & Bumrah enter auction? Ex-RCB star picks winner
content: As the IPL 2026 retention deadline looms, former cricketer Mohammad Kaif believes Jasprit Bumrah would command the highest bid if he, Virat Kohli, and Rohit Sharma were in the auction. Kaif highlighted Bumrah's generational match-winning ability as a bowler, placing him ahead of even the star batters in terms of pure cricketing value for franchises focused on business and returns.

title: Watch: Newly constructed bridge in China falls apart, splashes into river
content: A newly opened highway bridge in China's Sichuan province partially collapsed after landslides struck a nearby mountainside. The Hongqi bridge, crucial for travel between Sichuan and Tibet, was closed prior to the incident due to detected cracks and ground shifts. Fortunately, no casualties were reported as authorities had already shut down the structure.

title: Pulwama to Delhi: Did Faridabad bust trigger premature attack? Explosives match those seized
content: Panic and desperation drove a Jaish operative to carry out the Delhi blast after security forces busted hideouts, recovering nearly 3,000kg of explosives. Sources suggest the bomb was hastily assembled, limiting its impact.  The suspect, Dr. Umar, was identified from CCTV footage, and the explosives matched those found earlier.

title: IPL 2026: 'If Samson, Ruturaj open ... ' - Ashwin names CSK's next big target
content: Ravindra Jadeja and Sam Curran have reportedly given their consent to CSK to proceed with the final phase of their trade move to Rajasthan Royals, creating key gaps in the Super Kings’ lineup that will need to be filled ahead of the new season.

title: Delhi Red Fort blast: Al-Falah University website hacked after explosion
content: After a devastating car bombing and the discovery of a major explosives stash in Faridabad, Al-Falah University experienced a cyber breach on its website. A group taking credit for the hack released a declaration criticizing 'radical Islamic activities' and urged the university to refrain from anti-national pursuits.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 opens above 25,800; BSE Sensex up over 400 points
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, opened in green on Wednesday. While Nifty50 went above 25,800, BSE Sensex was up over 400 points.

title: Watch: 'Now You See Me: Now You Don’t' cast stuns fans with real card tricks
content: The cast of Now You See Me: Now You Don’t brought real-life illusion to its New York premiere, performing live magic tricks for fans and press. Featuring Jesse Eisenberg, Woody Harrelson, Dave Franco, and Ariana Greenblatt, the film’s third instalment blends cinematic spectacle with genuine sleight of hand, honed through months of on-set training with professional magicians.

title: 'Mama chacha to hai nahi': Ex-KKR player defends Gambhir
content: Former KKR player Manvinder Bisla defended coach Gautam Gambhir against accusations of favouritism towards Harshit Rana. Bisla dismissed the criticism as baseless, emphasising Rana's selection was based on merit and his strong performances against Australia. He highlighted Rana's crucial role in setting up India's victory in the third ODI, arguing his contributions were overlooked.

title: Jerry Jones gets emotional as Cowboys plan tribute for Marshawn Kneeland
content: The Dallas Cowboys are honoring the late Marshawn Kneeland, who tragically passed away at 24. Owner Jerry Jones revealed players will wear helmet decals and warm-up shirts to remember the young defensive end. The team is grappling with the profound loss, with Jones emphasizing the immense pressures NFL players face.

title: Michael Duarte cause of death: How did the food influencer FoodWithBearHands die
content: Beloved food creator Michael Duarte, known as FoodWithBearHands, tragically passed away in Texas on November 8, 2025, during a family trip. His sudden death, described as a "horrible incident," has left millions of fans mourning the loss of his cheerful personality and culinary talent. Duarte, a devoted husband and father, inspired many with his generosity and passion for food.

title: Donald Trump slams NFL’s new kickoff rule, calls it 'demeaning'
content: Donald Trump has voiced strong disapproval of the NFL's new kickoff rule, deeming it "terrible" and "demeaning" to the game's tradition and excitement. Speaking on The Pat McAfee Show, the former President argued that the changes, intended for player safety, have stripped the play of its "power" and "beautiful chaos," sparking renewed debate on preserving football's identity versus prioritizing safety.

title: Yankees Eye $460M Cubs Star to Replace Cody Bellinger in Free Agency
content: The New York Yankees face a pivotal offseason with key players Cody Bellinger and Trent Grisham set to become free agents. If both depart, the team is reportedly a top contender to sign star outfielder Kyle Tucker, who could significantly reshape their roster and offensive core for the 2026 season.

title: Top shares to buy: Stock recommendations for today - check list
content: Stock market recommendations: Mehul Kothari of Anand Rathi Shares recommends SAIL, Hindustan Zinc, and Nippon Life India Asset Management for investment. SAIL shows a trendline breakout and EMA alignment, Hindustan Zinc is reversing from its 200-DEMA with a bullish engulfing pattern, and Nippon Life India Asset Management has formed a double bottom.

title: Pune offers to host RCB home ties in Gahunje
content: Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) may end up playing all their home matches in Pune in IPL-2026, it has been learnt. The shift is a direct fallout of the Chinnaswamy Stadium’s ongoing suspension following the June 4 stampede during RCB’s victory parade.

title: Travel advisory: UK flags Indo-Pak border risk after Delhi blast; urges 'informed decisions'
content: Following a deadly car blast near Delhi's Red Fort that killed 12, the UK's FCDO has updated its travel advisory for British nationals. Citizens in Delhi are urged to remain cautious and follow local authorities' instructions. The advisory also reiterates existing warnings for border regions and Jammu and Kashmir due to security concerns.

title: Amid heavy security after suicide attack, Pak hold nerves to beat Sri Lanka in thriller
content: The match was played under tight security after a suicide attack earlier in the day in nearby Islamabad, which claimed at least 12 lives. The Pakistan Cricket Board confirmed that security around the Sri Lankan team was further strengthened following the incident.  Pakistan rode on a fighting unbeaten century from Salman Agha and a four-wicket burst by Haris Rauf to clinch a six-run win over Sri Lanka.

title: Boom time at Eden! Jasprit Bumrah leaves no stone unturned ahead of first Test
content: Jasprit Bumrah was among the most visible players in India’s nets on Tuesday and bowled mostly with a short run-up. “He has just come off a white ball series in Australia and for Tests, he has to prepare differently,” Gandhi said. “In the nets, he would be concentrating on length balls and probing the off-stump.”

title: ‘Unlike you, I can read’: Ilhan Omar hits back after Trump mocks her quoting US Constitution
content: President Trump's remarks questioning Congresswoman Ilhan Omar's right to comment on US politics due to her foreign background sparked a sharp retort. Omar, who fled Somalia's civil war, countered by highlighting her ability to read the Constitution, unlike the President. This exchange follows previous instances where Trump suggested she should "go back" to Somalia.

title: HR sent termination notice by mistake: 300 employees panicked; career lessons from chaos
content: An HR team's accidental test of an offboarding tool sent an email to all 300 employees stating their employment was terminated immediately. Chaos ensued as employees questioned the message, but IT quickly clarified it was a glitch. The incident highlighted the importance of automation oversight and the power of humor in crisis.

title: Flop show continues! Babar Azam adds another unwanted record to his name
content: Babar Azam's last century came against Nepal during the Asia Cup 2023, and he has now equaled Virat Kohli’s record for the most consecutive international innings without a hundred.

title: Why Jaire Alexander is stepping away from football after joining Eagles in shocking twist
content: Star cornerback Jaire Alexander is taking a break from football. He needs to focus on his health. This comes after a recent trade to the Philadelphia Eagles. Alexander has had injuries and team changes. He is now reflecting on his career. His next steps are uncertain as he prioritizes recovery and clarity.

title: ‘Don’t have notifications’: JPMorgan chief ignores most texts; keeps phone off at work
content: JPMorgan Chase CEO Jamie Dimon, leading America's largest bank, minimizes phone use during work, turning off notifications and ignoring texts except from his children. He advocates for focused, distraction-free meetings, believing multitasking signals poor engagement. Dimon also urges US schools to evolve by integrating coding, cybersecurity, and financial management to prepare students for the modern workforce.

title: Chhattisgarh: 6 Maoists killed in Bijapur encounter; security forces recover arms, ammo
content: Security forces engaged Maoists in Bijapur district. Six rebels were killed. Weapons and explosives were recovered. One Maoist was taken into custody. This operation marks a significant gain for security forces. The Chief Minister praised the personnel. The campaign against Naxalism continues.

title: Sussanne Khan breaks down at Zarine Khan’s prayer meet
content: Veteran actress Zarine Khan’s demise has left the entire Bollywood industry mourning. Her prayer meet was held a few days ago in Mumbai, attended by several celebrities including Jeetendra, Hrithik Roshan, Saif Ali Khan, Rakesh Roshan, and others. Recently, Zarine’s daughter Farah Khan Ali shared an emotional video from the late actress’ prayer meet on Instagram, in which Sussanne Khan is seen breaking down in tears.

title: PM Modi meets former Bhutan King, appreciates his efforts towards building bilateral ties
content: The Prime Minister also inaugurated the Punatsanchchhu-II project along with King Jigme Khesar Namgyel Wangchuck following their wide-ranging talks

title: Understanding culture crucial to making translation effective, says Booker Prize winner Deepa Bhasthi
content: Translation is a complex process. Language also carries various aspects of culture with it, says winner of International Booker Prize Deepa Bhasthi

title: Namma Metro services on Yellow Line briefly affected due to technical snag; fourth since launch
content: According to officials, the issue led to delays in train operations, causing inconvenience to commuters during the peak morning rush

title: Jaishankar meets counterpart Anita Anand on G7 sidelines, discusses rebuilding India-Canada ties
content: The External Affairs Minister’s trip to Canada comes a month after Ms. Anand visited India during which both sides unveiled an ambitious roadmap to boost ties in areas of trade, critical minerals and energy

title: Kerala local body election 2025: Mayors not in fray in civic polls, but may have a larger political responsibility awaiting them
content: Kozhikode Mayor Beena Philip and Kochi Mayor M. Anilkumar express a desire to return to organisational roles in their parties, while Thrissur Mayor M.K. Varghese hints at political ambitions. Thiruvananthapuram Mayor Arya Rajendran also appears to be primed for a larger political assignment

title: Foundation stone laid for ₹47.85-crore project to draw water from Khachur Barrage for Sedam in Karnataka
content: The project will provide a permanent solution to Sedam’s drinking water problem, says Minister Sharan Prakash Patil

title: Kerala local body polls: State Election Commission to keep a tab on use of AI
content: The commission will deploy experts across the State to ensure compliance with new guidelines aimed at identifying and labelling synthetic content, and maintaining level-playing field in the electoral arena.

title: Small political outfits plan to make it big in Kerala local body polls
content: Twenty20 Kizhakkambalam, Revolutionary Marxist Party (RMP), Social Democratic Party of India (SDPI), Welfare Party of India (WPI), Aam Aadmi Party (AAP), and the All-India Trinamool Congress (AITC) are among the main players in this category

title: Chhattisgarh to be free of Maoism before 2026, says CM Vishnu Deo Sai
content: Chhattisgarh government signed ₹33,000 crore investment MoUs with Gujarat firms during two-day summit

title: Maharashtra Transport Minister instructs to start AI-driven toll collection system
content: “Every day, the congestion hinders ambulances, school buses and essential services and also adds to pollution, wasting the time of passengers”

title: Centre approves CBI probe into Odisha recruitment scam
content: At present, the Crime Branch of the State Government is investigating the case following serious allegations of large-scale irregularities and corruption in the recruitment examination

title: IIT Bombay invites applications for advanced programmes in cybersecurity and software development
content: Cybersecurity and software development programmes to begin in January; applications open till December 31.

title: Bihar Assembly elections LIVE: Nine exit polls project decisive majority for NDA in Bihar
content: The exit polls conducted by various organisations on Tuesday predicted a return of the NDA government in the State, a poor show for the Opposition 'Mahagathbandhan', and a disappointing performance for Jan Suraaj

title: ‘Predictable tactic’: India strongly trashes Pakistan PM's allegations following terror attack in Islamabad
content: External Affairs Ministry spokesperson Randhir Jaiswal said the international community is well aware of the reality and will not be misled by Pakistan's "desperate" ploys

title: How Tamil Nadu witnessed the dramatic arrest and release of Karunanidhi and Stalin in 2001
content: In June 2001, former Tamil Nadu Chief Minister M. Karunanidhi’s midnight arrest sparked political outrage. Police dragged him from his home and later arrested M.K. Stalin and others in connection with alleged irregularities in the construction of 10 flyovers in Chennai

title: Tamil Nadu among top achievers at Udyog Samagam 2025
content: The Udyog Samagam 2025, held under the aegis of the Department for Promotion of Industry and Internal Trade (DPIIT) in New Delhi, was chaired by Union Minister of Commerce and Industry Piyush Goyal.

title: When a car bomb was dismantled after four tense days in Tamil Nadu
content: Killing at least 13 persons, a high intensity bomb blast in a slow moving car near the Red Fort in New Delhi has rocked the country and a terror angle is being probed. About 27 years ago, 60 kg of gelatin explosives planted in an abandoned car at Coimbatore in Tamil Nadu were removed after four nerve-wracking days and detonated.

title: KIFF centenary tributes: Bengal’s film fraternity hails Ritwik Ghatak as ‘voice of Partition, pioneer of alternative cinema’
content: As part of the centenary tribute, the 31st KIFF organised screenings of six of Ghatak’s films during the festival between November 6 and November 13, along with an exhibition with his memorabilia at Nandan, the panel discussion today, and the Ritwik Ghatak Memorial Conversation between filmmakers Adoor Gopalakrishnan and Anup Singh, scheduled for November 12

title: ‘Unacceptable’: Supreme Court condemns alleged assault of Kerala students in Delhi
content: The top court said that such acts of racial discrimination were wholly “unacceptable” in a country founded on pluralism

title: CBI arrests ‘conman’ and his associate in impersonation and bribery case
content: On November 10, the two accused were caught in Delhi while receiving ₹18 lakh from one Jagjit Singh Gill, sent by Vinod Parihar, CEO of Cybdeer Network Private Limited

title: Cong. alleges ‘vote chori’ in Kochi Corporation
content: District Congress Committee alleges attempts to add voters using the same house number with different house names and forged rental pacts

title: Rajasthan Chief Secretary Sudhansh Pant shifted to Centre
content: Sudhansh Pant’s sudden transfer to the Centre, following an approval by the Appointments Committee of the Cabinet (ACC) and coming just 14 months before his retirement, has raised speculations in the political and administrative circles in Jaipur

title: Raju Kage writes to Chief Minister seeking statehood for North Karnataka
content: Taking exception to regional imbalances, MLA of Kagawad Assembly segment and chairman of North Western Karnataka Road Transport Corporation (NWKRTC) Bharamagouda (Raju) Kage has raised the issue of a statehood for North Karnataka and has written to chief minister Siddaramaiah on the issue

title: Woman doctor arrested in J&K terror module case linked to Delhi car blast
content: Shaheen Saeed is the eighth accused arrested in the “terror module” linked Jaish-e-Mohammad and Ansar Ghazwat-ul-Hind, and according to a government source, her car was used to ferry explosives. The Delhi blast occurred hours after the discovery of 2,900 kg explosive substances and weapons in Faridabad.

title: A.P. CM reaffirms commitment to Minority welfare
content: Assures free education to Minority girls up to Intermediate, construction of Haj buildings in Kadapa and Vijayawada, one lakh financial assistance to Haj pilgrims

title: Hyderabad to host Northeast-Telugu film screenings on November 21, 22
content: The event has been planned to showcase cinematic diversity and foster cultural exchange between the Northeastern States and Telangana

title: Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal calls for India to go big on medical tourism as current share is ‘miniscule’
content: Government recognises that India can’t have a “chalk and cheese” medical system where the domestic population is not eligible for healthcare while our health facilities are focused only on international patients, he added

title: Women outnumber men in turnout despite fewer registrations than men after SIR cuts in Bihar
content: Despite four million fewer registrations, four lakh more women turned out to vote in Bihar’s Assembly elections

title: Nine exit polls project decisive majority for NDA in Bihar
content: Matrize has given 147-167 seats to NDA, 70-90 to Mahagatbandhan (MGB), 0-2 to Jan Suraaj Party (JSP) and 2-8 seats to others, while People’s Insight has predicted 133-148 seats for NDA, 87-102 to MGB, 0-2 to JSP, and 3-6 seats to others

title: Sub-registrar, real estate firm owner held for cheating landowner in Bengaluru
content: The complainant, who knew the real estate company owner, had entered into an oral agreement with him to develop residential sites on his land

title: In highest turnout since 1951, Bihar registers 67% polling
content: Poll panel says 62.8% men and 71.6% women voted in the two-phase election; BJP says it will “break the record of the 2010 election results”; Opposition says there is a wave in their favour, asks party workers to remain vigilant against ‘vote thieves’

title: Supreme Court raps Uttarakhand High Court for staying prosecution of former Director of Corbett Tiger Reserve over illegal tree-felling
content: Earlier, the Bench had directed the Indian Forest Service officer to appear before it on November 11 to explain why contempt proceedings should not be initiated against him for moving the High Court despite being aware that the matter was pending before the Supreme Court

title: Don’t use COP30 to change ‘architecture’ of Paris deal: India
content: The architecture refers to the ‘common but differentiated responsibilities’, which means that countries must do their bit to curb fossil fuel emissions without compromising on national priorities; India says the parties “must remain committed to and guided by equity”

title: Trinamool demands Home Minister resign for ‘failures on an industrial scale’
content: The West Bengal ruling party demanded the resignation of Union Home Minister Amit Shah over the Delhi blast and sought an explanation from the Prime Minister for visiting Bhutan just a day after the blast

title: States ruled by non-BJP parties insist on wider consultation on draft labour policy and codes
content: Labour Minister Mansukh Mandaviya launches Labour Chowk app to connect construction workers with employers

title: DDRC accelerates Uppada coastal wall construction and ghats development in Kakinada
content: 11 ghats will be developed along the river Godavari for Godavari Pushkarams-2027 in Kakinada district.

title: AAP, Congress attack BJP over security ‘lapses’; Delhi to pay ₹10 lakh to kin of blast victims
content: The AAP said that sympathy over social media has no value if the government cannot even provide ambulances for families to take the dead bodies home

title: Imported ideas like ‘inter-generational equity’ are anthropocentric, may not protect endangered species: Justice Narasimha
content: Justice Narasimha made these oral observations while hearing a petition on the conservation of the dying species of the Great Indian Bustard, which is being bred in captivity, and the Lesser Florican

title: Left parties condemn blast, call for time-bound probe
content: Both parties appealed to the public to remain vigilant and maintain peace and harmony, cautioning against any attempts at provocation.

title: Uttar Pradesh on high alert, raid conducted in Lucknow
content: Security arrangements at important establishments, religious places, crowded places, and other sensitive points are being re-reviewed and increased

title: Residents apprehensive despite KWA’s assurance of restored water supply in Kochi
content: ‘The concern is shared by consumers living at the tail end of the water distribution network, who often face disruptions whenever pipe bursts occur’

title: Differences in fares between budget and regular airlines blur
content: There has been no significant differences in fares between budget airlines and full-service airlines

title: Vijay’s TVK approaches ECI for poll symbol as it readies for 2026 electoral debut
content: The party’s joint general secretary C.T.R. Nirmal Kumar submits a list of preferred symbols to the ECI in New Delhi.

title: Welfare pensions could have been hiked to ₹3,000 had Centre cooperated: Govindan
content: CPI(M) State secretary says various issues, including Sabarimala, will be topics of discussion during local body polls and the LDF government has nothing to hide

title: Pawan Kalyan proposes Sanatana Dharma Parirakshana Board to safeguard Hindu traditions
content: Deputy Chief Minister says the proposed board will protect temples, promote Sanatana values, and ensure respect for Hindu faith in a secular democracy

title: Rahul’s Vote Chori campaign will help INDIA bloc in Tamil Nadu too: Selvaperunthagai
content: The Special Intensive Revision of the electoral rolls in Tamil Nadu has opened a debate among members of the public on why such an exercise is being carried out by the Election Commission, says the TNCC chief

title: INCOIS targets faster tsunami alerts using GNSS sensors, AI models
content: Scientists working to enhance early warning systems for tsunamis originating from Sumatra-Andaman subduction zone, aiming to reduce the warning time to less than five minutes

title: SCR launches QR-based ID system for outsourced staff, reviews winter safety preparedness
content: The platform ensures secure, efficient processing with features such as role-based access, OTP-based login, document uploads and a two-level verification and approval workflow before ID issuance.

title: Elevated walkway planned to connect Bengaluru airport metro station with KIA Terminal 1
content: KIA, one of India’s fastest-growing airports, is currently handling more than 37 million passengers annually and aims to reach over 60 million passengers per year within the next five years, according to officials

title: After AK-47 recovery, Kashmir hospitals order audit of doctors’ lockers
content: In an official communiqué, the Medical Superintendent of GMC, Anantnag, directed all heads of departments “to identify lockers and almirahs in their respective departments and wards and to label them with the names of the staff members to whom they are allotted”

title: Naidu to hand over 3 lakh houses under ‘House for All’ scheme on November 12
content: Chief Minister to launch mass house-warming ceremony from Annamayya district; over 3 lakh PMAY houses completed across Andhra Pradesh, beneficiaries to receive keys virtually

title: Supreme Court says SIR is not the country’s first electoral roll revamp; Opposition retorts that this one is 'farcical'
content: Opposition parties say current SIR is a rushed exercise; ask why Bihar voter roll is included as a document proof for SIR 2.0; call for transparency through acknowledgement slips, machine-readable roll

title: Bengaluru City Commissioners review dog control measures
content: It is important to conduct public awareness programmes to inform citizens about the department’s initiatives0

title: Mirwaiz condemns Delhi blast; Engineer Rashid to go on hunger strike in Jail
content: Rashid, who is at the Tihar Jail, in Delhi, has decided to go on a two-day hunger strike against the attack from November 12, according to his party

title: Delhi explosion: Kin of terror suspects in shock and disbelief
content: Nabi, the main suspect, was a ‘religious person and passionate cricketer’, who laid emphasis on higher studies, says family member

title: Heavy rain likely to occur in isolated places in southern districts of T.N. on Wednesday
content: Light to moderate rain is likely to occur at a few places over south Tamil Nadu and at isolated places over north Tamil Nadu, Puducherry, and Karaikal.

title: KSRTC to offer complimentary Nandini snack kits on Flybus services
content: Transport Minister Ramalinga Reddy will launch the new service at Terminal 2 of Kempegowda International Airport.

title: The Hindu Group’s Frontline launches collection of essays by Constitutional expert A.G. Noorani
content: The first few copies of the book were presented to Justice K. Chandru and Justice Prabha Sridevan, former judges of the Madras High Court, by N. Ram, Director, The Hindu Group Publishing Private Limited

title: Ministers review arrangements for Sri Sathya Sai Baba’s centenary celebrations in Puttaparthi
content: Group of Ministers led by Anagani Satyaprasad directs officials to ensure smooth conduct of week-long celebrations, with focus on traffic, sanitation, and medical facilities for devotees

title: Let's get mad! Why Miami and Texas Tech top our Week 12 Anger Index
content: After jumping up three spots, Miami still has plenty to be upset about, but what other teams should be mad?

title: Ohio St., IU, Texas A&M, Alabama top CFP ranking
content: The top five teams remained unchanged in the second set of rankings released by the College Football Playoff selection committee Tuesday, with Ohio State at No. 1, followed by fellow unbeatens Indiana and Texas A&M, and one-loss Alabama and Georgia.

title: Source: CB Alexander stepping away from football
content: Former Pro Bowl cornerback Jaire Alexander has decided to step away from football in order to focus on getting right physically and mentally amid his ongoing recovery from offseason knee surgery, a league source confirmed to ESPN on Tuesday.

title: NBA presents new ASG format, selection process
content: The NBA announced its overhauled All-Star Game format, including how Adam Silver will make sure the American and International teams both hit their quota of players.

title: Fiery Christie promises Kings will 'get it right'
content: Sacramento Kings coach Doug Christie indicated change is coming, saying the struggling team is facing a "bumpy" path and that the organization is "aligned in what we're doing."

title: Vogt (AL), Murphy (NL) repeat as Managers of Year
content: Cleveland's Stephen Vogt won his second straight AL Manager of the Year award and Milwaukee's Pat Murphy repeated for the NL honor.

title: Dombrowski has 'good conversation' with Harper
content: Dave Dombrowski, Phillies president of baseball operations, said he had a long conversation with star Bryce Harper recently but wouldn't go into specifics about what the two discussed.

title: Jags' Hunter has surgery, out for rest of season
content: Jaguars rookie wide receiver/cornerback Travis Hunter will miss the remainder of the season after undergoing surgery Tuesday to repair the LCL in his right knee.

title: Source: Free agent CB Samuel to join Steelers
content: Free agent cornerback Asante Samuel Jr. is signing with the Steelers on the practice squad, a source told ESPN's Jeremy Fowler on Tuesday.

title: 💰 Inside the Lakers' unbelievable $241M week
content: The Lakers' fifth-year guard now sits at the center of two major NBA storylines: Helping the team win enough to convince LeBron James to stay in L.A., but playing so well that it might cost the franchise nearly $250M dollars to keep him.

title: MLB Awards Week predictions, results: Murphy, Vogt take Manager of the Year awards
content: Baseball's best are collecting their hardware this week. On Tuesday, Pat Murphy and Stephen Vogt won Manager of the Year.

title: Men's Bracketology: Houston claims No. 1 overall seed, Georgetown cracks the field

content: 'It's hard to understand': Marshawn Kneeland's death has left loved ones reeling, according to interviews with his family, agent and former teammates.

title: Updated NFL Power Rankings: 1-32 poll, plus each team's non-QB MVP at midseason
content: Let's update our NFL Power Rankings ahead of Week 11. Plus, we picked every team's MVP -- not including quarterbacks.

content: Who has overachieved or underachieved in the first month, and will it continue? Here are four teams in each category.

content: In the end, the fear of being busted is about the only universal deterrent. Prison is a powerful disincentive.

content: The idea initially sounded so far-fetched band directors thought it was a prank. But the collaboration became a sensation.

content: With Travis Hunter now officially sidelined for the rest of 2025, Eric Moody takes a look at who to add on the Jags.

title: Spiraling Ferrari unfairly points finger at Hamilton, Leclerc
content: Ferrari is underperforming in 2025, and while its drivers are sharing their frustrations, chairman John Elkann is placing the blame at their feet.

content: "Josh Allen" was up 232% for sports-inspired cat names this year, according to a recent report by pet-sitting website Rover.

content: From stars with millions in off-court endorsements to those making the minimum, every WNBA player stands to gain in the new CBA.

content: Vergil Ortiz Jr. needed less than two rounds to retain the WBC interim junior middleweight title. Here are the latest ESPN rankings in all weight classes.

title: John Cena completes the career Grand Slam
content: John Cena beat Dominik Mysterio in an Intercontinental title match, but could these two face off again? Arda Ocal highlights the best moments from "Raw."

title: Heisman Trophy race: Who can still challenge Indiana's Fernando Mendoza?
content: As the odds shift for the Heisman Trophy race, Pamela Maldonado explains how to bet it heading into Week 12.

title: "Act Of War": Government Sources Say "Op Sindoor On" After Delhi Blast
content: In a warning to perpetrators of the Delhi terror blast, government sources reiterated that any terror operation on Indian soil will be considered an act of war.

title: PM Modi, Bhutan's Fourth King Discuss Bilateral Ties, Cultural Bonds
content: On Tuesday, Prime Minister Modi and Bhutanese King Jigme Khesar Namgyel Wangchuck held extensive discussions covering a wide spectrum of cooperation, including energy, capacity building, connectivity, technology, defence, and security.

title: 'US Doesn't Have Enough Talent': Trump Defends H-1B Visa Plan After Fee Hike
content: US President Donald Trump appears to have softened his stance on his administration's aggressive immigration reforms, saying America needs to bring in foreign talent for certain fields.

title: Red Fort Blast Live Updates: Delhi Blast Suspects Recced Red Fort In January, Sources Say
content: Delhi Blast Live Updates: The anti-terror agency, NIA, has taken over the probe and begun investigations at the scene.

title: 'Rs 58 Crore, Global Links': Police Probe One Of Biggest Digital Arrests
content: The Maharashtra Cyber Department probing the Rs 58 crore digital arrest case in Mumbai has found an international network with links extending to Hong Kong, China and Indonesia, an official said on Tuesday.

title: NCP "Never Misused Power Nor Acted Arrogantly": Ajit Pawar
content: Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Ajit Pawar, who heads the ruling NCP, on Tuesday said people continue to repose faith in his party because of its commitment to development and welfare-oriented politics.

title: 'No Changes': Google Denies Removing Western Sahara Border For Morocco Users
content: The dotted lines illustrating the border between Western Sahara and Morocco, indicating the former's disputed territory status, have never been visible to people using Google Maps in the latter, the company told AFP on Tuesday.

title: Bill To Allow 8 Republicans To Seek Damages For Capitol Riot Probe
content: Legislation moving through Congress that would end the government shutdown in the US would also allow eight Republican senators to seek hundreds of thousands of dollars in damages for the capitol riot probe done by the Biden administration.

title: "Foreign Students Good For US": Trump's U-Turn On MAGA's Immigration Agenda
content: In a major U-turn on his immigration agenda, US President Donald Trump has advocated for allowing foreign students to study in American universities.

title: Delhi Blast Victim's Family Wanted Funeral In Hometown Meerut, Wife Refused
content: Mohsin, a resident of Uttar Pradesh's Meerut, was killed in Monday's car bomb blast near Red Fort, Delhi. An argument broke out over the place of his burial.

title: Car Used In Delhi Bomb Blast Was First Seen At Connaught Place, Mayur Vihar
content: The white Hyundai i20 car that exploded near Delhi's Red Fort, killing nine people, was first seen at Connaught Place and Mayur Vihar hours before the blast.

title: i20 Car Used In Delhi Blast Didn't Move For 12 Days, Then Doctor Panicked
content: The suspected suicide bomber, Dr Umar Nabi drove the car out of the college campus on the morning of the attack, November 10, allegedly out of panic.

title: Noel Tata's Son Neville Appointed As Trustee Of Sir Dorabji Tata Trust
content: Tata Trusts Chairman Noel Tata's son Neville was on Tuesday inducted as a trustee on the Sir Dorabji Tata Trust.

title: Samples Of 2 Different Types Of Explosives Recovered From Delhi Blast Site
content: The Forensic Science Laboratory (FSL) team investigating the car explosion near Delhi's Red Fort has recovered two live cartridges and samples of two different types of explosives on Tuesday, sources said.

title: 10 Deer Killed By Stray Dogs At Newly Opened Kerala Zoo
content: A major security lapse was reported at Kerala's newly inaugurated Puthur Zoological Park in Thrissur, where at least 10 deer were killed by stray dogs.

title: Hundreds Protest Against Trump Son-In-Law's Property Project In Belgrade
content: Hundreds of people staged a demonstration in Belgrade on Tuesday against the planned demolition of a former army headquarters to make way for a luxury hotel complex that US President Donald Trump's son-in-law Jared Kushner wants to build.

title: Architecture Of Paris Agreement Must Not Be Altered: India At COP30
content: India on Tuesday reaffirmed its firm commitment to multilateralism and equity in global climate action, and said that developed nations must fulfil their legal obligations on finance, technology transfer and capacity building to developing countries.

title: Former Tirupati Temple Board Chief Questioned Over Adulterated Ghee Case
content: The probe agency on Tuesday questioned the former chief of Tirumala Tirupati Devasthanams (TTD) in connection with the alleged Tirumala ghee adulteration case.

title: S Jaishankar Meets UK Foreign Secretary On Sidelines Of G7 Meeting
content: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar met UK Foreign Secretary Yvette Cooper on the sidelines of the G7 Foreign Ministers Meet in Canada.

title: Climate Disasters Killed 80,000, Hit 1.3 Billion In India Since 1995: Report
content: India ranks ninth globally among countries most impacted by climate disasters over the past three decades, with nearly 430 extreme weather events killing more than 80,000 people, according to a new report.

title: Delhi AQI turns 'severe' for first time this year, Grap 3 enforced in NCR
content: Priyangi Agarwal writes on environmental and climate change issues, connecting these topics to the everyday lives of people. She tracks developments across the capital’s transport hubs—Delhi Metro, Namo Bharat Trains, and Delhi Airport—while also reporting on pressing social issues. Her stories blend data analysis with voices from the ground to tell human-centred narratives. Previously stationed in western Uttar Pradesh, she focused her coverage on minority issues, health, and human rights. Read More

title: Explosives collected over 2 years for multi-city strike: Shaheen
content: Bharti Jain is senior editor with The Times of India, New Delhi. She has been writing on security matters since 1996. Having covered the Union home ministry, security agencies, Election Commission and the ‘prime’ political beat, the Congress, for The Economic Times all these years, she moved to TOI in August 2012.
